intro: Boltonia seemannii, commonly known as the Eastern Boltonia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers, which bloom in late summer, consist of both ray and disc florets, creating a distinctive fluffy appearance. Boltonia seemannii is valued for its ornamental qualities and ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators.
